alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 19 at 9:31PM CDT until April 24 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in La Crosse WI has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Kickapoo River at Gays Mills affecting Crawford County. Trempealeau River at Dodge affecting Trempealeau and Buffalo Counties. Wisconsin River at Muscoda affecting Grant, Iowa and Richland zones. Yellow River at Necedah affecting Juneau County. .Recent rainfall combined with melting snow will cause river rises. The rivers may reach flood stage this weekend. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON TO MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Trempealeau River at Dodge. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon to Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, The railroad bridge about three quarters of a mile upstream from the gage can restrict the flow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 7.7 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 930 AM CDT.
